qas.question: When did the European debt Crisis begin?
What did the eurozone states that were thought to not be able to repay their debt face as a consequence?

answers.text: the ability of these states to borrow new money to further finance their budget deficits or to refinance existing unsustainable debt levels was strongly reduced

qas.question: Which country was the first to be at risk for soverign default?
Who brought Greece's financial crisis to the forefront?
What had Greece's previous government been hiding?

answers.text: its true indebtedness and budget deficit

qas.question: When did the European profit euphoria begin?
Which country was the last to be at risk for sovereign default?
Who ignored Greece's financial crisis the most?

plausible_answers.text: its true indebtedness and budget deficit

qas.question: What had Greece's previous government been showcasing?
What is never a shock in the eurozone?

context: From late <a0_0><b5_0>2009<b5_0/><a0_0/> a handful of mainly southern eurozone member states started being unable to repay their national Euro-denominated government debt or to finance the bail-out of troubled financial sectors under their national supervision without the assistance of third parties. This so-called European debt crisis began after <a2_0><b6_0>Greece<b6_0/><a2_0/>'s <a3_0><b7_0>new elected government<b7_0/><a3_0/> stopped masking <a4_0><b8_0>its true indebtedness and budget deficit<b8_0/><a4_0/> and openly communicated the imminent danger of a Greek sovereign default. <b9_0>Seeing a sovereign default<b9_0/> in the eurozone as a shock, the general public, international and European institutions, and the financial community started to intensively reassess the economic situation and creditworthiness of eurozone states. Those eurozone states being assessed as not financially sustainable enough on their current path, faced waves of credit rating downgrades and rising borrowing costs including increasing interest rate spreads. As a consequence, <a1_0>the ability of these states to borrow new money to further finance their budget deficits or to refinance existing unsustainable debt levels was strongly reduced<a1_0/>.
